subSubSection.paragraph:
Lyclene dentinebula
Černý, 2009
, in : Černý & Pinratana ,
Moths of Thailand
6 : 83, pl. 18, fig. 164. Type locality: “N. Thailand , Chiang Mai , Fang , Doi Pha Hom Pok ,
1400 m
, 20°02’54’’N , 99°09’49’’E ”.

Type material examined .
Holotype
( Fig. 5 ): male, “N. Thailand , Chiang Mai-prov , Fang distr. , Doi Pha Hom Pok ,
1400 m
, 20°02’54’’N , 99°09’49’’E ,
28.–29.XI.2005
leg. K. Černý ” / Red label ‘‘ Holotype
Lyclene dentinebula
sp. n. Karel Černý 2009 ’’/ QR-code label with unique number “NHMUK010605728” ( Coll. NHMUK ).

1600m
, between Fang and Nor Lae , 99°06’E ; 20°2’N ,

, leg. B. Herczig & G. Ronkay ( Coll. CKC )
;

.

Diagnosis . Forewing length is 11–11.5 mm (wingspan 22–23 mm ) in males.
Miltochrista dentinebula
differs clearly from other relatives by its conspicuous broad brownish grey shade between the postmedial and antemedial lines of the forewing. The male genital capsule of
M. dentinebula
is very similar to that of
M. obliquilinea
, but the distal saccular process of
M. dentinebula
is less curved. The aedeagus of
M. dentinebula
is significantly larger than that of
M. obliquilinea
in comparison to the genital capsule size. The vesica structures of the two species are very similar, but in
M. dentinebula
the dorsal diverticulum is larger, the medial section is more heavily granulated, and the bunch of cornuti contains five cornuti, whereas in
M. obliquilinea
the vesica bears three to four cornuti only. Female is unknown.
Distribution. North Thailand ( Chiang Mai , Lampang and Nan Provinces) ( Černý & Pinratana 2009 ).
